meanings.definition: The quality or state of being loose or slack
meanings.sent1: The laxity of the rope made it difficult to climb.
meanings.sent2: The hammock's laxity provided a comfortable place to relax.
meanings.sent3: The laxity of the rules at the party led to chaos.
meanings.sent4: Her mind wandered with the laxity of a meandering river.
meanings.sent5: The laxity of the grip on the jar caused it to slip from her hands.

meanings.sent1: The laxity in grading allowed for many mistakes to go unnoticed.
meanings.sent2: The laxity in security measures made it easy for intruders to enter.
meanings.sent3: The laxity in time management resulted in missed deadlines.
meanings.sent4: The laxity in discipline led to unruly behavior in the classroom.
meanings.sent5: The laxity in following instructions caused confusion among the team members.
